name: Quicklime, at plant
description:
This module shows limestone mining and lime production as 2 separate unit processes, and also shows it as 1 cradle-to-gate process., Lime is manufactured by calcining in a rotary kiln.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.
category: 31-33: Manufacturing/3274: Lime and Gypsum Product Manufacturing

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Includes calcination of limestone in a rotary kiln to produce lime.

sources.name: Franklin Associates (2004) Limestone Mining & Lime Production
U.S. Department of Energy, Office of Ene

dataGenerator.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

publication.name: Franklin Associates (2004) Limestone Mining & Lime Production

processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

flow.name: Quicklime, at plant
flow.category: Technosphere Flows/31-33: Manufacturing/3274: Lime and Gypsum Product Manufacturing

exchanges.description: The quantity of limestone required for the production of 1,000 lbs of lime was estimated from the calcining chemistry: 100 lbs of limestone (CaCO3) yield 56 lbs of lime (CaO) and 44 lbs of carbon dioxide (CO2). Also, a 95% oxides content of limestone was assumed.
